title: Credit card companies are calling family members who have nothig to do with it, and can give no information. is this legal?
question: Credit card companies are calling family members who have nothig to do with it, and can give no information. And they continue to do so. Is this legal?
answers:
You should gather as much proof of this as possible and seek an attorney who works in the area of the FDCPA.

I agree with my colleague but once they establish your family members don't know where you are they must stop.

It is legal only if the collections people are trying to locate your whereabouts. But once they are told there is no information, they are supposed to stop unless they have some proof they are being lied to.
